issue.title: URDF links without geometry cause spurious contacts.

content.raw:
properties for child link (e.g. mu) should have been carried over with the collision as part of the reduction process.  This appears fixed in my latest refactor of the lumping process in [sdformat pull request #225](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/225/collision_blobs/diff).

Actually I needed some test cases, so added files [fixed_joint_reduction_collision_extension.urdf](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/e867ab4e10ef321528d95ee03ff280545f16d267/test/integration/fixed_joint_reduction_collision_extension.urdf?at=collision_blobs&fileviewer=file-view-default) and [fixed_joint_reduction_collision_extension_empty_parent.urdf](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/e867ab4e10ef321528d95ee03ff280545f16d267/test/integration/fixed_joint_reduction_collision_extension_empty_parent.urdf?at=collision_blobs&fileviewer=file-view-default).  I tested running `gz sdf -p` on them and believe they are behaving correctly in the collision_blobs branch.
content.html:
properties for child link (e.g. mu) should have been carried over with the collision as part of the reduction process. This appears fixed in my latest refactor of the lumping process in sdformat pull request #225.

Actually I needed some test cases, so added files fixed_joint_reduction_collision_extension.urdf and fixed_joint_reduction_collision_extension_empty_parent.urdf. I tested running gz sdf -p on them and believe they are behaving correctly in the collision_blobs branch.
